Interface CalculatorInterface

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.rmi.Remote
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CalculatorRpnRmiServer

    public interface CalculatorInterface
extends java.rmi.Remote
    The interface for all calc engines to implement if they want be used with Calculator class
    Version:
    1.4
    Author:
    Anton Krug

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clear()
      The 'C' (clear) button was pressed.
      void del()
      The '<-' (del) button was pressed.
      void divide()
      The / button pressed
      void enter()
      The 'E' (enter) button was pressed.
      void equals()
      The '=' button was pressed.
      java.lang.String getAuthor()
      Return the author of this engine.
      int getDisplayValue()
      Return the display value
      java.lang.String getStackContent()
      Will return string listing the stack content of the calculator
      java.lang.String getTitle()
      Return the title of this calculation engine.
      java.lang.String getVersion()
      Return the version number of this engine.
      void minus()
      The 'minus' button was pressed.
      void modulo()
      The '%' (modulo) button was pressed.
      void multiply()
      The * button pressed
      void numberPressed(int number)
      A number button was pressed.
      void offOn()
      The 'I/O' (on / off) button was pressed.
      void plus()
      The 'plus' button was pressed.
      void pop()
      The 'P' (pop) button was pressed.

      • getVersion

        java.lang.String getVersion()
                     throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Return the version number of this engine. This string is displayed as it is, so it should say something like "Version 1.1".
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • numberPressed

        void numberPressed(int number)
            throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        A number button was pressed. Do whatever you have to do to handle it. The number value of the button is given as a parameter.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
